author: ZerandoNoHard

text:
As someone who somewhat recently got a Vita and got acquainted to P4 and P3P that way, I completely understand the need for portability. Persona (at least the most recent ones) is the kind of series you can put away and want to play anywhere, and roaming through these dungeons feels all the more satisfying that you can do it from the comfort of your bed on a lazy Sunday morning :D
Now, I don't know whether a Switch port would be realistic from a technical standpoint, but that'd definitely be pretty neat if it happens.
 (also: thank you for your work! Going onto your channel and listening to this track is the only P5R spoiler I'll allow myself for now. :D)

author: [MARECLO1208]

text:
God Marukis palace was so hard to go through.... I actually truly believed in his ideals. He had no ill will towards the masses his grudge was against the world. He wasnâ€™t trying to enslave anyone... just give them what they most desired. 

The â€œgoodâ€ ending brought me to tears.

-Futaba with her mom and going to Shujin
-Morgana being human and going out with Ann who got reunited with Shiho
-Ryuji with his team winning the track meet
-Makoto with her sister and father
-Yusuke becoming a famous artist
-Haru living a normal life with her dad
-Sumire(Kasumi) winning the gymnastics tournament.
-Joker and Akechi being rivals.

Itâ€™s the ending they all deserved after all they went through.... but itâ€™s still fake. And thatâ€™s not what theyâ€™re about

text:
When Iâ€™m first listening to this it sounds calming and relaxing. Itâ€™s almost as if Maruki is patting me on the back telling me itâ€™s all going to be okay and that this is a place where I can relax and eat snacks.

Spoilers:

When I listen to this after his palace, itâ€™s as if this theme is a whole new song. The formerly relaxing theme sounds ominous and detached, just like the purely happy world Maruki wants to create. This song makes me feel like Iâ€™m being put in a sterile environment with no free will, just as Maruki intends.

text: Persona 5 is a master piece in my opinion. Of course this game is not for everyone and all pieces of work will have its critics but what makes it a master piece is not the approval of everyone but the amount of appreciation that one gives upon being able to finish and reflect on how it has moved them. This game can really change your perspective on life and give it some meaning as well as motivate. That in my opinion is what makes its a master piece.

author: FalconPan

text: FalconPan I personally donâ€™t get the same vibes you do, and Maruki isnâ€™t a true villain Iâ€™d say. Heâ€™s definitely a good antagonist, but his actions donâ€™t come across as evil - he really just wants to help people, which is what birthed his palace and his distorted desires to create an entirely new reality for everyone.
author: Cloud Aggro

text: @Cloud Aggro I haven't finished the game yet, so I don't know exactly how everything geos down, but he honestly just seems very sensitive to me. When he was talking about the pain of a broken heart, and asking us whether we thought that was a good thing or necessary... I kinda knew where he was coming from. I think that overcoming pain can help us become stronger as people, but at the same time I don't think we should seek out difficult situations deliberately. When he says he feels that pain might be better off avoided, I dunno. I don't agree with his conclusions, but there's a part of me that relates to him. So it's difficult for me to see him in a negative light. I guess for that reason he makes a good antagonist. He feels believable, at least.

author: Just Someone

text:
I actually thought that Maruki was relatable because I'm like him. I get what he wants to do because it's something that I want to do.

The difference between us is that I want to inspire others and wake them up, while he wants to control and delude.

He thought that he had to carry a torch for others, when the real thing he should be doing is being the torch i.e. living by example.

If we want an ideal reality, we just need better role models.
author: Tyler DeVeau

text: @Tyler DeVeau As idealistic as that sounds we all know that won't change much lol. There's always going to be horrible people as long as people exist. The thing is you have to try your best to be the best you that you can be regardless.

author: MrKushGuy

text:
Sup Supradarky. Back when I was in college, now over 10 years ago, I ran a radio show at my college independent radio station. On the show, I played video game music exclusively. I'd play them off my iPod, or CDs, rarely on vinyl, and sometimes straight off of youtube. That's when I discovered your channel, and I used it a lot to help me discover tunes and soundtracks I never listened to before. 


That show was a blast to run. I did it for 5 years. And to see you still today sharing your great taste in VGM puts a smile on my face. Keep it up, and thanks for everything.
author: Stephen Palacio

text: That's awesome, 5 years is a lot of dedication. I have to say, I wish my college back then had a show like yours. Knowing the list can have this kind of influence and make other people happy is one of many reasons I keep going. Cheers!
author: SupraDarky

text:
@SupraDarky I know what you mean - there's something special about sharing the awesomeness of VGM! The only reason I stopped doing the show was because I had to move away for awhile. However I have kept collecting video game vinyl records over the years. I finally had the idea this year to do some chill music streams once in awhile, just letting the records play. It's been fun it its own way. 
Anyway, I hope you always keep your motivation to continue with the consistent uploads here. Even though I've been sort of an aficionado for a long time, you still introduce me to great stuff I've never heard, both new and old, regularly. In fact one my favorite things about your channel is you change it up all the time. You don't just upload a bunch of tracks from the same game at the same time. Thanks again!
author: Stephen Palacio

text: That's an amazing story to read, also inspiring :)
author: Francis Rave

text: Persona slaying yet again. So chill and will definitely go to my study playlist!
author: Giovanni

text: Funky.
